text:
Коллеги из Роттердама ищут PhD студентов с хорошими DS скилами и готовностью разбираться с эпидемиологией на интересный проект "3D Facial Shape Analysis". Тема горячая, они собирают уникальный датасет (вообще универ очень известен как раз большими популяционными исследованиями) - на мой взгляд, хорошие вводные для топовых DS публикаций. Кусочки описания ниже, полная версия - вот тут: <http://www.medicaldelta.nl/Vacancies?ViewMode=DetailView&id=33>

*Description*
This project will focus on developing methods (based on machine learning and deep
learning technologies) to derive complex facial measurements in a unique dataset
comprising thousands of 3D facial images of children from the prospective,
longitudinal, population-based Generation R birth cohort (<https://www.generationr.nl/>)
and elderly population-based Rotterdam Study (<http://www.ergo-onderzoek.nl/> ) . 3D
facial morphology exists in a high-dimensional feature space, which cannot be
analyzes using simple Euclidean metrics. Accordingly, the ultimate aim of this project is
to leverage the large-scale 3D facial imaging, which provides extensive genetic and
epidemiological measures, to unravel the complexity between genetics, facial
morphology and health outcomes.

*Conditions of employment*
You will receive a temporary position for 4 years. The gross monthly salary is € 2.279 in
the 1st year and increases to € 2.919 in the 4th year (scale OIO). End of year bonus, a
holiday gratification and personal budget for your personal development. The terms of
employment are according to the Collective Bargaining Agreement for Dutch University
Medical Centers (CAO UMC).

*Application*
To apply, please e-mail a detailed CV along with a motivation letter to Gennady Roshchupkin, <mailto:g.roshchupkin@erasmusmc.nl|g.roshchupkin@erasmusmc.nl>
When applying for this position, please refer to vacancy “PhD facial shape analysis”.
